00052 //Set the preferred platform vendor using the OpenCL SDK
00053 static const char* spPlatformVendor =
00054 #if defined(CL_PLATFORM_MINI_CL)
00055 "MiniCL, SCEA";
00056 #elif defined(CL_PLATFORM_AMD)
00057 "Advanced Micro Devices, Inc.";
00058 #elif defined(CL_PLATFORM_NVIDIA)
00059 "NVIDIA Corporation";
00060 #elif defined(CL_PLATFORM_INTEL)
00061 "Intel(R) Corporation";
00062 #elif defined(B3_USE_CLEW)
00063 "clew (OpenCL Extension Wrangler library)";
00064 #else
00065 "Unknown Vendor";
00066 #endif
00067 
00068 #ifndef CL_PLATFORM_MINI_CL
00069 #ifdef _WIN32
00070 #ifndef B3_USE_CLEW
00071 #include "CL/cl_gl.h"
00072 #endif //B3_USE_CLEW
00073 #endif //_WIN32

00077 void MyFatalBreakAPPLE(   const char *  errstr ,
00078                        const void *  private_info ,
00079                        size_t        cb ,
00080                        void *        user_data  )
00081 {
00082    
00083 
00084     const char* patloc = strstr(errstr, "Warning");
00085     //find out if it is a warning or error, exit if error
00086 
00087     if (patloc)
00088     {
00089                 b3Warning("Warning: %s\n", errstr);
00090     } else
00091     {
00092                 b3Error("Error: %s\n", errstr);
00093         b3Assert(0);
00094     }
00095 
00096 }

00100 int b3OpenCLUtils_clewInit()
00101 {
00102         int result = -1;
00103 
00104 #ifdef _WIN32
00105         const char* cl = "OpenCL.dll";
00106 #elif defined __APPLE__
00107         const char* cl = "/System/Library/Frameworks/OpenCL.framework/Versions/Current/OpenCL";
00108 #else//presumable Linux?
00109         //linux (tested on Ubuntu 12.10 with Catalyst 13.4 beta drivers, not that there is no symbolic link from libOpenCL.so
00110         const char* cl = "libOpenCL.so.1";
00111         result = clewInit(cl);
00112         if (result != CLEW_SUCCESS)
00113         {
00114                 cl = "libOpenCL.so";
00115         } else
00116         {
00117                 clewExit();
00118         }
00119 #endif
00120         result = clewInit(cl);
00121         if (result!=CLEW_SUCCESS)
00122                 {
00123                 b3Error("clewInit failed with error code %d\n",result);
00124                 }
00125         else
00126         {
00127                 b3Printf("clewInit succesfull using %s\n",cl);
00128         }
00129         return result;
00130 }
00131 #endif

00133 int b3OpenCLUtils_getNumPlatforms(cl_int* pErrNum)
00134 {
00135 #ifdef B3_USE_CLEW
00136         b3OpenCLUtils_clewInit();
00137 #endif
00138 
00139         cl_platform_id pPlatforms[10] = { 0 };
00140 
00141     cl_uint numPlatforms = 0;
00142     cl_int ciErrNum = clGetPlatformIDs(10, pPlatforms, &numPlatforms);
00143         //cl_int ciErrNum = clGetPlatformIDs(0, NULL, &numPlatforms);
00144 
00145         if(ciErrNum != CL_SUCCESS)
00146         {
00147                 if(pErrNum != NULL)
00148                         *pErrNum = ciErrNum;
00149         }
00150         return numPlatforms;
00151 
00152 }

00164 cl_platform_id b3OpenCLUtils_getPlatform(int platformIndex0, cl_int* pErrNum)
00165 {
00166 #ifdef B3_USE_CLEW
00167         b3OpenCLUtils_clewInit();
00168 #endif
00169 
00170         cl_platform_id platform = 0;
00171         unsigned int platformIndex = (unsigned int )platformIndex0;
00172         cl_uint numPlatforms;
00173         cl_int ciErrNum = clGetPlatformIDs(0, NULL, &numPlatforms);
00174 
00175         if (platformIndex<numPlatforms)
00176         {
00177                 cl_platform_id* platforms = (cl_platform_id*) malloc (sizeof(cl_platform_id)*numPlatforms);
00178                 ciErrNum = clGetPlatformIDs(numPlatforms, platforms, NULL);
00179                 if(ciErrNum != CL_SUCCESS)
00180                 {
00181                         if(pErrNum != NULL)
00182                                 *pErrNum = ciErrNum;
00183                         return platform;
00184                 }
00185 
00186                 platform = platforms[platformIndex];
00187 
00188                 free (platforms);
00189         }
00190 
00191         return platform;
00192 }
00193 
00194 void b3OpenCLUtils::getPlatformInfo(cl_platform_id platform, b3OpenCLPlatformInfo* platformInfo)
00195 {
00196         b3Assert(platform);
00197         cl_int ciErrNum;
00198         ciErrNum = clGetPlatformInfo(   platform,CL_PLATFORM_VENDOR,B3_MAX_STRING_LENGTH,platformInfo->m_platformVendor,NULL);
00199         oclCHECKERROR(ciErrNum,CL_SUCCESS);
00200         ciErrNum = clGetPlatformInfo(   platform,CL_PLATFORM_NAME,B3_MAX_STRING_LENGTH,platformInfo->m_platformName,NULL);
00201         oclCHECKERROR(ciErrNum,CL_SUCCESS);
00202         ciErrNum = clGetPlatformInfo(   platform,CL_PLATFORM_VERSION,B3_MAX_STRING_LENGTH,platformInfo->m_platformVersion,NULL);
00203         oclCHECKERROR(ciErrNum,CL_SUCCESS);
00204 }

00206 void b3OpenCLUtils_printPlatformInfo( cl_platform_id platform)
00207 {
00208         b3OpenCLPlatformInfo platformInfo;
00209         b3OpenCLUtils::getPlatformInfo (platform, &platformInfo);
00210         b3Printf("Platform info:\n");
00211         b3Printf("  CL_PLATFORM_VENDOR: \t\t\t%s\n",platformInfo.m_platformVendor);
00212         b3Printf("  CL_PLATFORM_NAME: \t\t\t%s\n",platformInfo.m_platformName);
00213         b3Printf("  CL_PLATFORM_VERSION: \t\t\t%s\n",platformInfo.m_platformVersion);
00214 }

00217 
00218 cl_context b3OpenCLUtils_createContextFromPlatform(cl_platform_id platform, cl_device_type deviceType, cl_int* pErrNum, void* pGLContext, void* pGLDC, int preferredDeviceIndex, int preferredPlatformIndex)
00219 {
00220         cl_context retContext = 0;
00221         cl_int ciErrNum=0;
00222         cl_uint num_entries;
00223         cl_device_id devices[B3_MAX_CL_DEVICES];
00224         cl_uint num_devices;
00225         cl_context_properties* cprops;
00226 
00227         /*
00228         * If we could find our platform, use it. Otherwise pass a NULL and get whatever the
00229         * implementation thinks we should be using.
00230         */
00231         cl_context_properties cps[7] = {0,0,0,0,0,0,0};
00232         cps[0] = CL_CONTEXT_PLATFORM;
00233         cps[1] = (cl_context_properties)platform;
00234 #ifdef _WIN32
00235 #ifndef B3_USE_CLEW
00236         if (pGLContext && pGLDC)
00237         {
00238                 cps[2] = CL_GL_CONTEXT_KHR;
00239                 cps[3] = (cl_context_properties)pGLContext;
00240                 cps[4] = CL_WGL_HDC_KHR;
00241                 cps[5] = (cl_context_properties)pGLDC;
00242         }
00243 #endif //B3_USE_CLEW
00244 #endif //_WIN32
00245         num_entries = B3_MAX_CL_DEVICES;
00246 
00247 
00248         num_devices=-1;
00249 
00250         ciErrNum = clGetDeviceIDs(
00251                 platform,
00252                 deviceType,
00253                 num_entries,
00254                 devices,
00255                 &num_devices);
00256 
00257     if (ciErrNum<0)
00258     {
00259         b3Printf("clGetDeviceIDs returned %d\n",ciErrNum);
00260         return 0;
00261     }
00262         cprops = (NULL == platform) ? NULL : cps;
00263 
00264         if (!num_devices)
00265                 return 0;
00266 
00267         if (pGLContext)
00268         {
00269                 //search for the GPU that relates to the OpenCL context
00270                 unsigned int i;
00271                 for (i=0;i<num_devices;i++)
00272                 {
00273                         retContext = clCreateContext(cprops,1,&devices[i],NULL,NULL,&ciErrNum);
00274                         if (ciErrNum==CL_SUCCESS)
00275                                 break;
00276                 }
00277         }
00278         else
00279         {
00280                 if (preferredDeviceIndex>=0 && (unsigned int)preferredDeviceIndex<num_devices)
00281                 {
00282                         //create a context of the preferred device index
00283                         retContext = clCreateContext(cprops,1,&devices[preferredDeviceIndex],NULL,NULL,&ciErrNum);
00284                 } else
00285                 {
00286                         //create a context of all devices
00287 #if defined (__APPLE__)
00288                         retContext = clCreateContext(cprops,num_devices,devices,MyFatalBreakAPPLE,NULL,&ciErrNum);
00289 #else
00290         b3Printf("numDevices=%d\n",num_devices);
00291 
00292                         retContext = clCreateContext(cprops,num_devices,devices,NULL,NULL,&ciErrNum);
00293 #endif
00294                 }
00295         }
00296         if(pErrNum != NULL)
00297         {
00298                 *pErrNum = ciErrNum;
00299         };
00300 
00301         return retContext;
00302 }
00303 
00304 cl_context b3OpenCLUtils_createContextFromType(cl_device_type deviceType, cl_int* pErrNum, void* pGLContext, void* pGLDC , int preferredDeviceIndex, int preferredPlatformIndex, cl_platform_id* retPlatformId)
00305 {
00306 #ifdef B3_USE_CLEW
00307         b3OpenCLUtils_clewInit();
00308 #endif
00309 
00310 
00311         cl_uint numPlatforms;
00312         cl_context retContext = 0;
00313         unsigned int i;
00314 
00315         cl_int ciErrNum = clGetPlatformIDs(0, NULL, &numPlatforms);
00316         if(ciErrNum != CL_SUCCESS)
00317         {
00318                 if(pErrNum != NULL) *pErrNum = ciErrNum;
00319                 return NULL;
00320         }
00321         if(numPlatforms > 0)
00322         {
00323                 cl_platform_id* platforms = (cl_platform_id*) malloc (sizeof(cl_platform_id)*numPlatforms);
00324                 ciErrNum = clGetPlatformIDs(numPlatforms, platforms, NULL);
00325                 if(ciErrNum != CL_SUCCESS)
00326                 {
00327                         if(pErrNum != NULL)
00328                                 *pErrNum = ciErrNum;
00329                         free(platforms);
00330                         return NULL;
00331                 }
00332 
00333 
00334 
00335                 for ( i = 0; i < numPlatforms; ++i)
00336                 {
00337                         char pbuf[128];
00338                         ciErrNum = clGetPlatformInfo(   platforms[i],
00339                                 CL_PLATFORM_VENDOR,
00340                                 sizeof(pbuf),
00341                                 pbuf,
00342                                 NULL);
00343                         if(ciErrNum != CL_SUCCESS)
00344                         {
00345                                 if(pErrNum != NULL) *pErrNum = ciErrNum;
00346                                 return NULL;
00347                         }
00348 
00349                         if (preferredPlatformIndex>=0 && i==preferredPlatformIndex)
00350                         {
00351                                 cl_platform_id tmpPlatform = platforms[0];
00352                                 platforms[0] = platforms[i];
00353                                 platforms[i] = tmpPlatform;
00354                                 break;
00355                         } else
00356                         {
00357                                 if(!strcmp(pbuf, spPlatformVendor))
00358                                 {
00359                                         cl_platform_id tmpPlatform = platforms[0];
00360                                         platforms[0] = platforms[i];
00361                                         platforms[i] = tmpPlatform;
00362                                 }
00363                         }
00364                 }
00365 
00366                 for (i = 0; i < numPlatforms; ++i)
00367                 {
00368                         cl_platform_id platform = platforms[i];
00369                         assert(platform);
00370 
00371                         retContext = b3OpenCLUtils_createContextFromPlatform(platform,deviceType,pErrNum,pGLContext,pGLDC,preferredDeviceIndex,preferredPlatformIndex);
00372 
00373                         if (retContext)
00374                         {
00375 //                              printf("OpenCL platform details:\n");
00376                                 b3OpenCLPlatformInfo platformInfo;
00377 
00378                                 b3OpenCLUtils::getPlatformInfo(platform, &platformInfo);
00379 
00380                                 if (retPlatformId)
00381                                         *retPlatformId = platform;
00382 
00383                                 break;
00384                         }
00385                 }
00386 
00387                 free (platforms);
00388         }
00389         return retContext;
00390 }

00392 
00400 cl_device_id b3OpenCLUtils_getDevice(cl_context cxMainContext, int deviceIndex)
00401 {
00402         assert(cxMainContext);
00403 
00404         size_t szParmDataBytes;
00405         cl_device_id* cdDevices;
00406         cl_device_id device ;
00407 
00408         // get the list of devices associated with context
00409         clGetContextInfo(cxMainContext, CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES, 0, NULL, &szParmDataBytes);
00410 
00411         if( szParmDataBytes / sizeof(cl_device_id) < (unsigned int)deviceIndex ) {
00412                 return (cl_device_id)-1;
00413         }
00414 
00415         cdDevices = (cl_device_id*) malloc(szParmDataBytes);
00416 
00417         clGetContextInfo(cxMainContext, CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES, szParmDataBytes, cdDevices, NULL);
00418 
00419         device = cdDevices[deviceIndex];
00420         free(cdDevices);
00421 
00422         return device;
00423 }
00424 
00425 int b3OpenCLUtils_getNumDevices(cl_context cxMainContext)
00426 {
00427         size_t szParamDataBytes;
00428         int device_count;
00429         clGetContextInfo(cxMainContext, CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES, 0, NULL, &szParamDataBytes);
00430         device_count = (int) szParamDataBytes/ sizeof(cl_device_id);
00431         return device_count;
00432 }

00435 
00436 void b3OpenCLUtils::getDeviceInfo(cl_device_id device, b3OpenCLDeviceInfo* info)
00437 {
00438         // CL_DEVICE_NAME
00439         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_NAME, B3_MAX_STRING_LENGTH, &info->m_deviceName, NULL);
00440 
00441         // CL_DEVICE_VENDOR
00442         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_VENDOR, B3_MAX_STRING_LENGTH, &info->m_deviceVendor, NULL);
00443 
00444         // CL_DRIVER_VERSION
00445         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DRIVER_VERSION, B3_MAX_STRING_LENGTH, &info->m_driverVersion, NULL);
00446 
00447         // CL_DEVICE_INFO
00448         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_TYPE, sizeof(cl_device_type), &info->m_deviceType, NULL);
00449 
00450         // CL_DEVICE_MAX_COMPUTE_UNITS
00451         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_COMPUTE_UNITS, sizeof(info->m_computeUnits), &info->m_computeUnits, NULL);
00452 
00453         // CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_DIMENSIONS
00454         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_DIMENSIONS, sizeof(info->m_workitemDims), &info->m_workitemDims, NULL);
00455 
00456         // CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_SIZES
00457         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_SIZES, sizeof(info->m_workItemSize), &info->m_workItemSize, NULL);
00458 
00459         // CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_GROUP_SIZE
00460         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_GROUP_SIZE, sizeof(info->m_workgroupSize), &info->m_workgroupSize, NULL);
00461 
00462         // CL_DEVICE_MAX_CLOCK_FREQUENCY
00463         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_CLOCK_FREQUENCY, sizeof(info->m_clockFrequency), &info->m_clockFrequency, NULL);
00464 
00465         // CL_DEVICE_ADDRESS_BITS
00466         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_ADDRESS_BITS, sizeof(info->m_addressBits), &info->m_addressBits, NULL);
00467 
00468         // CL_DEVICE_MAX_MEM_ALLOC_SIZE
00469         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_MEM_ALLOC_SIZE, sizeof(info->m_maxMemAllocSize), &info->m_maxMemAllocSize, NULL);
00470 
00471         // CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_SIZE
00472         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_SIZE, sizeof(info->m_globalMemSize), &info->m_globalMemSize, NULL);
00473 
00474         // CL_DEVICE_ERROR_CORRECTION_SUPPORT
00475         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_ERROR_CORRECTION_SUPPORT, sizeof(info->m_errorCorrectionSupport), &info->m_errorCorrectionSupport, NULL);
00476 
00477         // CL_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_TYPE
00478         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_TYPE, sizeof(info->m_localMemType), &info->m_localMemType, NULL);
00479 
00480         // CL_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_SIZE
00481         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_SIZE, sizeof(info->m_localMemSize), &info->m_localMemSize, NULL);
00482 
00483         // CL_DEVICE_MAX_CONSTANT_BUFFER_SIZE
00484         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_CONSTANT_BUFFER_SIZE, sizeof(info->m_constantBufferSize), &info->m_constantBufferSize, NULL);
00485 
00486         // CL_DEVICE_QUEUE_PROPERTIES
00487         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, sizeof(info->m_queueProperties), &info->m_queueProperties, NULL);
00488 
00489         // CL_DEVICE_IMAGE_SUPPORT
00490         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_IMAGE_SUPPORT, sizeof(info->m_imageSupport), &info->m_imageSupport, NULL);
00491 
00492         // CL_DEVICE_MAX_READ_IMAGE_ARGS
00493         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_READ_IMAGE_ARGS, sizeof(info->m_maxReadImageArgs), &info->m_maxReadImageArgs, NULL);
00494 
00495         // CL_DEVICE_MAX_WRITE_IMAGE_ARGS
00496         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WRITE_IMAGE_ARGS, sizeof(info->m_maxWriteImageArgs), &info->m_maxWriteImageArgs, NULL);
00497 
00498         // CL_DEVICE_IMAGE2D_MAX_WIDTH, CL_DEVICE_IMAGE2D_MAX_HEIGHT, CL_DEVICE_IMAGE3D_MAX_WIDTH, CL_DEVICE_IMAGE3D_MAX_HEIGHT, CL_DEVICE_IMAGE3D_MAX_DEPTH
00499         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_IMAGE2D_MAX_WIDTH, sizeof(size_t), &info->m_image2dMaxWidth, NULL);
00500         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_IMAGE2D_MAX_HEIGHT, sizeof(size_t), &info->m_image2dMaxHeight, NULL);
00501         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_IMAGE3D_MAX_WIDTH, sizeof(size_t), &info->m_image3dMaxWidth, NULL);
00502         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_IMAGE3D_MAX_HEIGHT, sizeof(size_t), &info->m_image3dMaxHeight, NULL);
00503         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_IMAGE3D_MAX_DEPTH, sizeof(size_t), &info->m_image3dMaxDepth, NULL);
00504 
00505         // CL_DEVICE_EXTENSIONS: get device extensions, and if any then parse & log the string onto separate lines
00506         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_EXTENSIONS, B3_MAX_STRING_LENGTH, &info->m_deviceExtensions, NULL);
00507 
00508         // CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_<type>
00509         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_CHAR, sizeof(cl_uint), &info->m_vecWidthChar, NULL);
00510         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_SHORT, sizeof(cl_uint), &info->m_vecWidthShort, NULL);
00511         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_INT, sizeof(cl_uint), &info->m_vecWidthInt, NULL);
00512         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_LONG, sizeof(cl_uint), &info->m_vecWidthLong, NULL);
00513         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_FLOAT, sizeof(cl_uint), &info->m_vecWidthFloat, NULL);
00514         clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_DOUBLE, sizeof(cl_uint), &info->m_vecWidthDouble, NULL);
00515 }
00516 
00517 
00518 void b3OpenCLUtils_printDeviceInfo(cl_device_id device)
00519 {
00520         b3OpenCLDeviceInfo info;
00521         b3OpenCLUtils::getDeviceInfo(device,&info);
00522         b3Printf("Device Info:\n");
00523         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_NAME: \t\t\t%s\n", info.m_deviceName);
00524         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_VENDOR: \t\t\t%s\n", info.m_deviceVendor);
00525         b3Printf("  CL_DRIVER_VERSION: \t\t\t%s\n", info.m_driverVersion);
00526 
00527         if( info.m_deviceType & CL_DEVICE_TYPE_CPU )
00528                 b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_TYPE:\t\t\t%s\n", "CL_DEVICE_TYPE_CPU");
00529         if( info.m_deviceType & CL_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU )
00530                 b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_TYPE:\t\t\t%s\n", "CL_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU");
00531         if( info.m_deviceType & CL_DEVICE_TYPE_ACCELERATOR )
00532                 b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_TYPE:\t\t\t%s\n", "CL_DEVICE_TYPE_ACCELERATOR");
00533         if( info.m_deviceType & CL_DEVICE_TYPE_DEFAULT )
00534                 b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_TYPE:\t\t\t%s\n", "CL_DEVICE_TYPE_DEFAULT");
00535 
00536         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_MAX_COMPUTE_UNITS:\t\t%u\n", info.m_computeUnits);
00537         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_DIMENSIONS:\t%u\n", info.m_workitemDims);
00538         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_SIZES:\t%u / %u / %u \n", info.m_workItemSize[0], info.m_workItemSize[1], info.m_workItemSize[2]);
00539         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_GROUP_SIZE:\t%u\n", info.m_workgroupSize);
00540         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_MAX_CLOCK_FREQUENCY:\t%u MHz\n", info.m_clockFrequency);
00541         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_ADDRESS_BITS:\t\t%u\n", info.m_addressBits);
00542         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_MAX_MEM_ALLOC_SIZE:\t\t%u MByte\n", (unsigned int)(info.m_maxMemAllocSize/ (1024 * 1024)));
00543         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_SIZE:\t\t%u MByte\n", (unsigned int)(info.m_globalMemSize/ (1024 * 1024)));
00544         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_ERROR_CORRECTION_SUPPORT:\t%s\n", info.m_errorCorrectionSupport== CL_TRUE ? "yes" : "no");
00545         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_TYPE:\t\t%s\n", info.m_localMemType == 1 ? "local" : "global");
00546         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_SIZE:\t\t%u KByte\n", (unsigned int)(info.m_localMemSize / 1024));
00547         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_MAX_CONSTANT_BUFFER_SIZE:\t%u KByte\n", (unsigned int)(info.m_constantBufferSize / 1024));
00548         if( info.m_queueProperties  & CL_QUEUE_OUT_OF_ORDER_EXEC_MODE_ENABLE )
00549                 b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_QUEUE_PROPERTIES:\t\t%s\n", "CL_QUEUE_OUT_OF_ORDER_EXEC_MODE_ENABLE");
00550         if( info.m_queueProperties & CL_QUEUE_PROFILING_ENABLE )
00551                 b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_QUEUE_PROPERTIES:\t\t%s\n", "CL_QUEUE_PROFILING_ENABLE");
00552 
00553         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_IMAGE_SUPPORT:\t\t%u\n", info.m_imageSupport);
00554 
00555         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_MAX_READ_IMAGE_ARGS:\t%u\n", info.m_maxReadImageArgs);
00556         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_MAX_WRITE_IMAGE_ARGS:\t%u\n", info.m_maxWriteImageArgs);
00557         b3Printf("\n  CL_DEVICE_IMAGE <dim>");
00558         b3Printf("\t\t\t2D_MAX_WIDTH\t %u\n", info.m_image2dMaxWidth);
00559         b3Printf("\t\t\t\t\t2D_MAX_HEIGHT\t %u\n", info.m_image2dMaxHeight);
00560         b3Printf("\t\t\t\t\t3D_MAX_WIDTH\t %u\n", info.m_image3dMaxWidth);
00561         b3Printf("\t\t\t\t\t3D_MAX_HEIGHT\t %u\n", info.m_image3dMaxHeight);
00562         b3Printf("\t\t\t\t\t3D_MAX_DEPTH\t %u\n", info.m_image3dMaxDepth);
00563         if (*info.m_deviceExtensions != 0)
00564         {
00565                 b3Printf("\n  CL_DEVICE_EXTENSIONS:%s\n",info.m_deviceExtensions);
00566         }
00567         else
00568         {
00569                 b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_EXTENSIONS: None\n");
00570         }
00571         b3Printf("  CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_<t>\t");
00572         b3Printf("CHAR %u, SHORT %u, INT %u,LONG %u, FLOAT %u, DOUBLE %u\n\n\n",
00573                 info.m_vecWidthChar, info.m_vecWidthShort, info.m_vecWidthInt, info.m_vecWidthLong,info.m_vecWidthFloat, info.m_vecWidthDouble);
00574 
00575 
00576 }
00577 
00578 
00579 static const char* strip2(const char* name, const char* pattern)
00580 {
00581           size_t const patlen = strlen(pattern);
00582         size_t patcnt = 0;
00583           const char * oriptr;
00584           const char * patloc;
00585                 // find how many times the pattern occurs in the original string
00586           for (oriptr = name; (patloc = strstr(oriptr, pattern)); oriptr = patloc + patlen)
00587           {
00588                 patcnt++;
00589           }
00590           return oriptr;
00591 }
00592 
00593 cl_program b3OpenCLUtils_compileCLProgramFromString(cl_context clContext, cl_device_id device, const char* kernelSourceOrg, cl_int* pErrNum, const char* additionalMacrosArg , const char* clFileNameForCaching, bool disableBinaryCaching)
00594 {
00595         const char* additionalMacros = additionalMacrosArg?additionalMacrosArg:"";
00596 
00597         if (disableBinaryCaching)
00598         {
00599                 //kernelSourceOrg = 0;
00600         }
00601 
00602         cl_program m_cpProgram=0;
00603         cl_int status;
00604 
00605         char binaryFileName[B3_MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
00606 
00607         char deviceName[256];
00608         char driverVersion[256];
00609         const char* strippedName;
00610         int fileUpToDate = 0;
00611 #ifdef _WIN32
00612         int binaryFileValid=0;
00613 #endif  
00614         if (!disableBinaryCaching && clFileNameForCaching)
00615         {
00616                 clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_NAME, 256, &deviceName, NULL);
00617                 clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DRIVER_VERSION, 256, &driverVersion, NULL);
00618         
00619                 strippedName = strip2(clFileNameForCaching,"\\");
00620                 strippedName = strip2(strippedName,"/");
00621         
00622 #ifdef _MSVC_VER
00623                 sprintf_s(binaryFileName,B3_MAX_STRING_LENGTH,"%s/%s.%s.%s.bin",sCachedBinaryPath,strippedName, deviceName,driverVersion );
00624 #else
00625                 sprintf(binaryFileName,"%s/%s.%s.%s.bin",sCachedBinaryPath,strippedName, deviceName,driverVersion );
00626 #endif
00627         }
00628         if (clFileNameForCaching && !(disableBinaryCaching || gDebugSkipLoadingBinary||gDebugForceLoadingFromSource) )
00629         {
00630                 
00631 #ifdef _WIN32
00632         char* bla=0;
00633 
00634         
00635 
00636                 //printf("searching for %s\n", binaryFileName);
00637 
00638 
00639                 FILETIME modtimeBinary;
00640                 CreateDirectoryA(sCachedBinaryPath,0);
00641                 {
00642 
00643                         HANDLE binaryFileHandle = CreateFileA(binaryFileName,GENERIC_READ,0,0,OPEN_EXISTING,FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL,0);
00644                         if (binaryFileHandle ==INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00645                         {
00646                                 DWORD errorCode;
00647                                 errorCode = GetLastError();
00648                                 switch (errorCode)
00649                                 {
00650                                 case ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND:
00651                                         {
00652                                                 b3Warning("\nCached file not found %s\n", binaryFileName);
00653                                                 break;
00654                                         }
00655                                 case ERROR_PATH_NOT_FOUND:
00656                                         {
00657                                                 b3Warning("\nCached file path not found %s\n", binaryFileName);
00658                                                 break;
00659                                         }
00660                                 default:
00661                                         {
00662                                                 b3Warning("\nFailed reading cached file with errorCode = %d\n", errorCode);
00663                                         }
00664                                 }
00665                         } else
00666                         {
00667                                 if (GetFileTime(binaryFileHandle, NULL, NULL, &modtimeBinary)==0)
00668                                 {
00669                                         DWORD errorCode;
00670                                         errorCode = GetLastError();
00671                                         b3Warning("\nGetFileTime errorCode = %d\n", errorCode);
00672                                 } else
00673                                 {
00674                                         binaryFileValid = 1;
00675                                 }
00676                                 CloseHandle(binaryFileHandle);
00677                         }
00678 
00679                         if (binaryFileValid)
00680                         {
00681                                 HANDLE srcFileHandle = CreateFileA(clFileNameForCaching,GENERIC_READ,0,0,OPEN_EXISTING,FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL,0);
00682 
00683                                 if (srcFileHandle==INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00684                                 {
00685                                         const char* prefix[]={"./","../","../../","../../../","../../../../"};
00686                                         for (int i=0;(srcFileHandle==INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) && i<5;i++)
00687                                         {
00688                                                 char relativeFileName[1024];
00689                                                 sprintf(relativeFileName,"%s%s",prefix[i],clFileNameForCaching);
00690                                                 srcFileHandle = CreateFileA(relativeFileName,GENERIC_READ,0,0,OPEN_EXISTING,FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL,0);
00691                                         }
00692 
00693                                 }
00694 
00695 
00696                                 if (srcFileHandle!=INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00697                                 {
00698                                         FILETIME modtimeSrc;
00699                                         if (GetFileTime(srcFileHandle, NULL, NULL, &modtimeSrc)==0)
00700                                         {
00701                                                 DWORD errorCode;
00702                                                 errorCode = GetLastError();
00703                                                 b3Warning("\nGetFileTime errorCode = %d\n", errorCode);
00704                                         }
00705                                         if (  ( modtimeSrc.dwHighDateTime < modtimeBinary.dwHighDateTime)
00706                                                 ||(( modtimeSrc.dwHighDateTime == modtimeBinary.dwHighDateTime)&&(modtimeSrc.dwLowDateTime <= modtimeBinary.dwLowDateTime)))
00707                                         {
00708                                                 fileUpToDate=1;
00709                                         } else
00710                                         {
00711                                                 b3Warning("\nCached binary file out-of-date (%s)\n",binaryFileName);
00712                                         }
00713                                         CloseHandle(srcFileHandle);
00714                                 }
00715                                 else
00716                                 {
00717 #ifdef _DEBUG
00718                                         DWORD errorCode;
00719                                         errorCode = GetLastError();
00720                                         switch (errorCode)
00721                                         {
00722                                         case ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND:
00723                                                 {
00724                                                         b3Warning("\nSrc file not found %s\n", clFileNameForCaching);
00725                                                         break;
00726                                                 }
00727                                         case ERROR_PATH_NOT_FOUND:
00728                                                 {
00729                                                         b3Warning("\nSrc path not found %s\n", clFileNameForCaching);
00730                                                         break;
00731                                                 }
00732                                         default:
00733                                                 {
00734                                                         b3Warning("\nnSrc file reading errorCode = %d\n", errorCode);
00735                                                 }
00736                                         }
00737 
00738                                         //we should make sure the src file exists so we can verify the timestamp with binary
00739 //                                      assert(0);
00740                                         b3Warning("Warning: cannot find OpenCL kernel %s to verify timestamp of binary cached kernel %s\n",clFileNameForCaching, binaryFileName);
00741                                         fileUpToDate = true;
00742 #else
00743                                         //if we cannot find the source, assume it is OK in release builds
00744                                         fileUpToDate = true;
00745 #endif
00746                                 }
00747                         }
00748 
00749 
00750                 }
00751 
00752         
00753 
00754 #else
00755         fileUpToDate = true;
00756         if (mkdir(sCachedBinaryPath,0777) == -1)
00757         {
00758         }
00759         else
00760         {
00761                 b3Printf("Succesfully created cache directory: %s\n", sCachedBinaryPath);
00762         }
00763 #endif //_WIN32
00764         }
00765         
00766         
00767         if( fileUpToDate)
00768         {
00769 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00770                 FILE* file;
00771                 if (fopen_s(&file,binaryFileName, "rb")!=0)
00772                         file=0;
00773 #else
00774                 FILE* file = fopen(binaryFileName, "rb");
00775 #endif
00776                 
00777                 if (file)
00778                 {
00779                         size_t binarySize=0;
00780                         char* binary =0;
00781                         
00782                         fseek( file, 0L, SEEK_END );
00783                         binarySize = ftell( file );
00784                         rewind( file );
00785                         binary = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char)*binarySize);
00786                         int bytesRead;
00787                         bytesRead = fread( binary, sizeof(char), binarySize, file );
00788                         fclose( file );
00789                         
00790                         m_cpProgram = clCreateProgramWithBinary( clContext, 1,&device, &binarySize, (const unsigned char**)&binary, 0, &status );
00791                         b3Assert( status == CL_SUCCESS );
00792                         status = clBuildProgram( m_cpProgram, 1, &device, additionalMacros, 0, 0 );
00793                         b3Assert( status == CL_SUCCESS );
00794                         
00795                         if( status != CL_SUCCESS )
00796                         {
00797                                 char *build_log;
00798                                 size_t ret_val_size;
00799                                 clGetProgramBuildInfo(m_cpProgram, device, CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG, 0, NULL, &ret_val_size);
00800                                 build_log = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char)*(ret_val_size+1));
00801                                 clGetProgramBuildInfo(m_cpProgram, device, CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG, ret_val_size, build_log, NULL);
00802                                 build_log[ret_val_size] = '\0';
00803                                 b3Error("%s\n", build_log);
00804                                 free (build_log);
00805                                 b3Assert(0);
00806                                 m_cpProgram = 0;
00807 
00808                                 b3Warning("clBuildProgram reported failure on cached binary: %s\n",binaryFileName);
00809 
00810                         } else
00811                         {
00812                                 b3Printf("clBuildProgram successfully compiled cached binary: %s\n",binaryFileName);    
00813                         }
00814                         free (binary);
00815                         
00816                 } else
00817                 {
00818                         b3Warning("Cannot open cached binary: %s\n",binaryFileName);
00819                 }
00820         }
00821         
00822         
00823         
00824         
00825         
00826         
00827         
00828         
00829         
00830         if (!m_cpProgram)
00831         {
00832 
00833                 cl_int localErrNum;
00834                 char* compileFlags;
00835                 int flagsize;
00836 
00837 
00838 
00839                 const char* kernelSource = kernelSourceOrg;
00840 
00841                 if (!kernelSourceOrg || gDebugForceLoadingFromSource)
00842                 {
00843                         if (clFileNameForCaching)
00844                         {
00845 
00846                                 FILE* file = fopen(clFileNameForCaching, "rb");
00847                                 //in many cases the relative path is a few levels up the directory hierarchy, so try it
00848                                 if (!file)
00849                                 {
00850                                         const char* prefix[]={"../","../../","../../../","../../../../"};
00851                                         for (int i=0;!file && i<3;i++)
00852                                         {
00853                                                 char relativeFileName[1024];
00854                                                 sprintf(relativeFileName,"%s%s",prefix[i],clFileNameForCaching);
00855                                                 file = fopen(relativeFileName, "rb");
00856                                         }
00857                                 }
00858 
00859                                 if (file)
00860                                 {
00861                                         char* kernelSrc=0;
00862                                         fseek( file, 0L, SEEK_END );
00863                                         int kernelSize = ftell( file );
00864                                         rewind( file );
00865                                         kernelSrc = (char*)malloc(kernelSize+1);
00866                                         int readBytes;
00867                                         readBytes = fread((void*)kernelSrc,1,kernelSize, file);
00868                                         kernelSrc[kernelSize] = 0;
00869                                         fclose(file);
00870                                         kernelSource = kernelSrc;
00871                                 }
00872                         }
00873                 }
00874 
00875                 size_t program_length = kernelSource ? strlen(kernelSource) : 0;
00876 #ifdef MAC //or __APPLE__?
00877                 char* flags = "-cl-mad-enable -DMAC ";
00878 #else
00879                 const char* flags = "";
00880 #endif
00881 
00882 
00883                 m_cpProgram = clCreateProgramWithSource(clContext, 1, (const char**)&kernelSource, &program_length, &localErrNum);
00884                 if (localErrNum!= CL_SUCCESS)
00885                 {
00886                         if (pErrNum)
00887                                 *pErrNum = localErrNum;
00888                         return 0;
00889                 }
00890 
00891                 // Build the program with 'mad' Optimization option
00892 
00893 
00894 
00895                         flagsize = sizeof(char)*(strlen(additionalMacros) + strlen(flags) + 5);
00896                 compileFlags = (char*) malloc(flagsize);
00897 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00898                 sprintf_s(compileFlags,flagsize, "%s %s", flags, additionalMacros);
00899 #else
00900                 sprintf(compileFlags, "%s %s", flags, additionalMacros);
00901 #endif
00902                 localErrNum = clBuildProgram(m_cpProgram, 1, &device, compileFlags, NULL, NULL);
00903                 if (localErrNum!= CL_SUCCESS)
00904                 {
00905                         char *build_log;
00906                         size_t ret_val_size;
00907                         clGetProgramBuildInfo(m_cpProgram, device, CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG, 0, NULL, &ret_val_size);
00908                         build_log = (char*) malloc(sizeof(char)*(ret_val_size+1));
00909                         clGetProgramBuildInfo(m_cpProgram, device, CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG, ret_val_size, build_log, NULL);
00910 
00911                         // to be carefully, terminate with \0
00912                         // there's no information in the reference whether the string is 0 terminated or not
00913                         build_log[ret_val_size] = '\0';
00914 
00915 
00916                         b3Error("Error in clBuildProgram, Line %u in file %s, Log: \n%s\n !!!\n\n", __LINE__, __FILE__, build_log);
00917                         free (build_log);
00918                         if (pErrNum)
00919                                 *pErrNum = localErrNum;
00920                         return 0;
00921                 }
00922 
00923 
00924                 if( !disableBinaryCaching && clFileNameForCaching )
00925                 {       //      write to binary
00926 
00927                         cl_uint numAssociatedDevices;
00928                         status = clGetProgramInfo( m_cpProgram, CL_PROGRAM_NUM_DEVICES, sizeof(cl_uint), &numAssociatedDevices, 0 );
00929                         b3Assert( status == CL_SUCCESS );
00930                         if (numAssociatedDevices==1)
00931                         {
00932 
00933                                 size_t binarySize;
00934                                 char* binary ;
00935 
00936                                 status = clGetProgramInfo( m_cpProgram, CL_PROGRAM_BINARY_SIZES, sizeof(size_t), &binarySize, 0 );
00937                                 b3Assert( status == CL_SUCCESS );
00938 
00939                                 binary = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char)*binarySize);
00940 
00941                                 status = clGetProgramInfo( m_cpProgram, CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES, sizeof(char*), &binary, 0 );
00942                                 b3Assert( status == CL_SUCCESS );
00943 
00944                                 {
00945                                         FILE* file=0;
00946 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00947                                         if (fopen_s(&file,binaryFileName, "wb")!=0)
00948                                                 file=0;
00949 #else
00950                                         file = fopen(binaryFileName, "wb");
00951 #endif
00952                                         if (file)
00953                                         {
00954                                                 fwrite( binary, sizeof(char), binarySize, file );
00955                                                 fclose( file );
00956                                         } else
00957                                         {
00958                                                 b3Warning("cannot write file %s\n", binaryFileName);
00959                                         }
00960                                 }
00961 
00962                                 free (binary);
00963                         }
00964                 }
00965 
00966                 free(compileFlags);
00967 
00968         }
00969         return m_cpProgram;
00970 }
00971 
00972 
00973 cl_kernel b3OpenCLUtils_compileCLKernelFromString(cl_context clContext, cl_device_id device, const char* kernelSource, const char* kernelName, cl_int* pErrNum, cl_program prog, const char* additionalMacros )
00974 {
00975 
00976         cl_kernel kernel;
00977         cl_int localErrNum;
00978 
00979         cl_program m_cpProgram = prog;
00980 
00981         b3Printf("compiling kernel %s ",kernelName);
00982 
00983         if (!m_cpProgram)
00984         {
00985                 m_cpProgram = b3OpenCLUtils_compileCLProgramFromString(clContext,device,kernelSource,pErrNum, additionalMacros,0, false);
00986         }
00987 
00988 
00989         // Create the kernel
00990         kernel = clCreateKernel(m_cpProgram, kernelName, &localErrNum);
00991         if (localErrNum != CL_SUCCESS)
00992         {
00993                 b3Error("Error in clCreateKernel, Line %u in file %s, cannot find kernel function %s !!!\n\n", __LINE__, __FILE__, kernelName);
00994         assert(0);
00995                 if (pErrNum)
00996                         *pErrNum = localErrNum;
00997                 return 0;
00998         }
00999 
01000         if (!prog && m_cpProgram)
01001         {
01002                 clReleaseProgram(m_cpProgram);
01003         }
01004         b3Printf("ready. \n");
01005 
01006 
01007         if (pErrNum)
01008                         *pErrNum = CL_SUCCESS;
01009         return kernel;
01010 
01011 }
